tool.name: load
tool.command:
chakin load go '$input' '$organism_id' '$analysis_id'
#if $query_type: --query_type '$query_type' #end if #if $match_on_name: $match_on_name #end if #if $name_column: --name_column '$name_column' #end if #if $go_column: --go_column '$go_column' #end if #if $re_name: --re_name '$re_name' #end if #if $skip_missing: $skip_missing #end if
| jq -S . > $results

param.name: input
param.label: Input
param.help: Path to the input tabular file to load

param.name: query_type
param.label: Query Type
param.help: The feature type (e.g. 'gene', 'mRNA', 'polypeptide', 'contig') of the query. It must be a valid Sequence Ontology term.

param.name: match_on_name
param.label: Match On Name
param.help: Match features using their name instead of their uniquename

param.name: name_column
param.label: Name Column
param.help: Column containing the feature identifiers (2, 3, 10 or 11; default=2).

param.name: re_name
param.label: Re Name
param.help: Regular expression to extract the feature name from the input file (first capturing group will be used).

param.name: skip_missing
param.label: Skip Missing
param.help: Skip lines with unknown features or GO id instead of aborting everything.

tool.help:
Load GO annotation from a tabular file, in the same way as does the tripal_analysis_go module
@HELP@
